citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A buck was observed with a healing wound on the left lower leg near the foot. There was an area of the skin
approximately 2 inches in size that was dark and appeared to be scabs or scar tissue. The animal was not limping and the
area was not swollen. The facility had not observed the injury and did not contact their veterinarian or apply any
treatments.
Wounds to the legs can be painful, cause lameness, and may become infected if not treated.
The facility must observe the animals daily to assess their health and well-being and communicate issues with animal
health to their veterinarian.

The poultry waterer used for 17 quail contained a green substance that appeared to be algae on the lower part that the
quail drink from and in the upper reservoir.
Failure to clean and sanitize waterers often enough to prevent accumulation of organic material including algae can result
in decreased water intake or spread of disease which can negatively impact the health of the animals.
Watering receptacles must be kept clean and sanitized as necessary to maintain the health and well-being of the animals.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
